newly created Puffer module"}},"createNewRestakingOperator(string,address,uint32)":{"details":"See IDelegationManager(EigenLayer) for more details about the other parametersSignature verification follows these rules: 1) If this address is left as address(0), then any staker will be free to delegate to the operator, i.e. no signature verification will be performed. 2) If this address is an EOA (i.e. it has no code), then we follow standard ECDSA signature verification for delegations to the operator. 3) If this address is a contract (i.e. it has code) then we forward a call to the contract and verify that it returns the correct EIP-1271 \"magic value\".","params":{"delegationApprover":"Address to verify signatures when a staker wishes to delegate to the operator, as well as controlling callVerifyAndProcessWithdrawals(bytes32,.details: See IEigenPod(EigenLayer) for more details about the other parameters

callVerifyWithdrawalCredentials(bytes32,.details: See IEigenPod(EigenLayer) for more details about the other parameters

params.amountToWithdraw: is the amount of ETH to withdraw

createNewPufferModule(bytes32).details: This function creates a new Puffer module with the given module name

createNewRestakingOperator(string,addres.details: See IDelegationManager(EigenLayer) for more details about the other parametersSignature verification follows these rules: 1) If this address is left as address(0), then any staker will be free to delegate to the operator, i.e. no signature verification will be performed. 2) If this address is an EOA (i.e. it has no code), then we follow standard ECDSA signature verification for delegations to the operator. 3) If this address is a contract (i.e. it has code) then we forward a call to the contract and verify that it returns the correct EIP-1271 "magic value".

params.delegationApprover: Address to verify signatures when a staker wishes to delegate to the operator, as well as controlling "forced undelegations".
params.metadataURI: is a URI for the operator's metadata, i.e. a link providing more details on the operator.

params.customCalldata: is the calldata to be passed to the target contract
params.target: is the address of the target contract that ReOp will call

params.restakingOperator: is the address of the restaking operator
params.signer: is the address of the signature signer

PUFFER_MODULE_BEACON().notice: Returns the Puffer Module beacon address

RESTAKING_OPERATOR_BEACON().notice: Returns the Restaking Operator beacon address

callDelegateTo(bytes32,address,(bytes,ui.notice: Calls the callDelegateTo function on the target module

callDeregisterOperatorFromAVS(address,ad.notice: Deregisters the caller from one or more quorums

callModifyOperatorDetails(address,(addre.notice: Calls the modifyOperatorDetails function on the restaking operator

callOptIntoSlashing(address,address).notice: Calls the optIntoSlashing function on the restaking operator

callRegisterOperatorToAVS(address,addres.notice: Registers msg.sender as an operator for one or more quorums. If any quorum exceeds its maximum operator capacity after the operator is registered, this method will fail.

callRegisterOperatorToAVSWithChurn(addre.notice: Registers msg.sender as an operator for one or more quorums. If any quorum reaches its maximum operator capacity, `operatorKickParams` is used to replace an old operator with the new one.

callUndelegate(bytes32).notice: Calls the callUndelegate function on the target module

callUpdateMetadataURI(address,string).notice: Calls the updateOperatorMetadataURI function on the restaking operator

callUpdateOperatorAVSSocket(address,addr.notice: Updates the socket of the msg.sender given they are a registered operator

callVerifyAndProcessWithdrawals(bytes32,.notice: Calls the verifyAndProcessWithdrawals function from the PufferModule `moduleName` with the given parameters

callVerifyWithdrawalCredentials(bytes32,.notice: Calls `verifyWithdrawalCredentials` from the PufferModule `moduleName` with the given parameters

customExternalCall(address,address,bytes.notice: Calls the `target` contract with `customCalldata` from the Restaking Operator contract
